results.title: The Vale of Kashmir
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into the Himalayas”.
The Vale of Kashmir has been the destination of tourists for centuries. Kashmir is renowned throughout the world for its exquisite crafts and exotic houseboats lining the shores of picturesque Dal Lake. Keith Adam looks behind the tourist facade to find the lifestyle of the real Kashmiri.

results.title: Pink narcissus
results.brief_description: In this imaginatively erotic surrealist film a young man (Bobby Kendall) escapes the confines of the real world through the personas of a slave, bullfighter, wood nymph and harem boy; all shot in a glorious sequence of pink hued fantasies. One of the most infamous gay films produced, it played to a sold out crowd at the 1984 New York Gay Film Festival. Shot on 8mm by Anonymous (James Bidgood has been credited as director since 1984), the final edit of this video was completed by Martin Jay Sadoff who included the musical track and sound effects.

results.title: Rumtek Monastery
results.creator_credit: Stafford Garner, Bill Steller, Chris McCullough and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into the Himalayas”.
Concentrates on the Buddhist Monastery at Rumtek, a small village in the tiny Himalayan kingdom of Sikkin. Explores in detail what is perhaps one of the purest remaining examples of practising Tibetan Buddhism. Narrated by Keith Adam.

results.title: Bhutan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into the Himalayas”.
A trip to Bhutan, the mysterious, rarely filmed kingdom nestling in the folds of the great Himalayas. Narrated by Keith Adam.

results.title: Pilgrimage
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into the Himalayas”.
Keith Adam mounts an expedition to the source of India’s sacred river, the Ganges. Hundreds of thousands of devout Hindus make the gruelling journey from the hot, dusty plains of the Indian sub-continent to witness, for the first time in their lives, the terrifying grandeur of the Himalayan peaks which give birth to the holiest of all rivers.

results.title: Pink Floyd - The Wall
results.creator_credit: Gerald Scarfe, Allan Parker, Alan Marshall, Goldcrest and Tin Blue
results.brief_description: Pink Floyd’s landmark album was translated into an original rock music motion picture experience. Bob Geldof plays Pink, a burnt out rock superstar who thinks he is going mad inside a room at a Los Angeles hotel. The film takes us on a downward spiral into Pink’s hell. Live action is intercut with brilliant animation by Gerald Scarfe and the soundtrack by Pink Floyd has given this film its cult status.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerald Scarfe, Allan Parker, Alan Marshall, Goldcrest and Tin Blue

results.title: The Bakrawallahs
results.creator_credit: Stafford Garner and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into the Himalayas”.
Keith Adam visits the Bakrawallas, nomadic goatherders living in the remote and beautiful peaks of Kashmir. We follow the events from announcement to ceremony of a Wedding between a groom of sixteen and a veiled bride

results.title: The Sherpas of Everest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into the Himalayas”.
The story of Sherpa, Sirdar Ang Tsering, one of the few men ever to stand atop the summit of Everest. He is shown making a pilgrimage from his home village of Namche Bazar to the mountain which has made him famous.

results.title: Pingu: Pingu and his friends
results.creator_credit: PINGU B V NL and Pingu Filmstudio
results.brief_description: Pingu and his family and friends invite you to join them in ten of their stories of fun and games. Stories on the tape include: ‘Pingu plays ice hockey’; ‘Pingu and Pinga don’t want to go to bed’; ‘Pingu on the makeshift skis’; ‘Pingu runs away from home’; ‘Pingu builds an igloo’; ‘Pingu has music lessons from his grandfather’; ‘Pingu in the ice cave’; ‘Pingu’s tobogganing’; ‘Pingu’s grandfather is sick’; ‘Pingu at school’.
